title: Mirabilis (plant)
text:
Mirabilis is a genus of plants in the family <a href="Nyctaginaceae">Nyctaginaceae</a> known as the four-o'clocks or umbrellaworts. The best known species may be "<a href="Mirabilis%20jalapa">Mirabilis jalapa</a>", the plant most commonly called four o'clock.
There are several dozen species in the genus, of herbaceous plants, mostly found in the <a href="Americas">Americas</a>. Some form <a href="tuberous%20root">tuberous root</a>s that enable them to perennate through dry and cool seasons. They have small, often fragrant, deep-throated <a href="flower">flower</a>s.
Although best known as <a href="ornamental%20plant">ornamental plant</a>s, at least one species, "mauka" ("<a href="Mirabilis%20expansa">M. expansa</a>"), is grown for food.
